Key Match Events: Alek Thomas hit a pinch-hit two-run homer off Craig Kimbrel in the eighth inning
Gabriel Moreno hit an RBI single in the eighth inning
Cristopher Sanchez started but was chased in the first inning
Kyle Schwarber hit his 19th postseason home run, a record for left-handed hitters
Andrew Saalfrank walked the bases loaded in the sixth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks have shown resilience and belief in their ability to compete despite being underdogs
Zac Gallen and Zack Wheeler will start for the Diamondbacks and Phillies respectively in Game 5
The Diamondbacks' bullpen has been crucial in keeping the score close
Post-Match Reflections: Torey Lovullo believes the Diamondbacks are a 'damn good baseball team'
Alek Thomas expressed trust in the coaching staff and excitement in the clubhouse
The Diamondbacks' young core, including 23-year-olds like Thomas, Moreno, Corbin Carroll, and Geraldo Perdomo, performed well in the postseason
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Chase Field with a crowd of 47,806
The Diamondbacks went from the team with the worst record to two wins from the World Series
